definition: full of tender feelings (idiom); tender-hearted
to keep/to contain/to suck (keep in your mouth without chewing)
feeling/emotion/passion/situation
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)
see 脈脈|脉脉[mo4 mo4]
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)
see 脈脈|脉脉[mo4 mo4]

sentences.english: After dinner, woman cooed some suggestive little sighs and slipped invitingly into bed.
sentences.chinese: 晚飯後，女人含情脈脈，楚楚動人的躺到牀上。

sentences.english: Tom's been making sheep's eyes at his girlfriend all night long.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆整個晚上都在含情脈脈地注視着他的女友。

sentences.english: One night when Xiangruwas reading books in the courtyard, he was surprised to see a beautiful girl on the wall looking at him affectionately.
sentences.chinese: 只見牆上一美麗少女，含情脈脈地看他讀書。

sentences.english: She gave him a tender look and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 她含情脈脈地看了他一眼，朝他微笑。

sentences.english: One night when Xiangruwas reading books in the courtyard， he was surprised to see a beautiful girl on the wall looking at him affectionately.
sentences.chinese: 只見牆上一美麗少女，含情脈脈地看他讀書。

definition: loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
loss of love/breakup of a relationship
the second person/(fig.) someone else/third party
microphone/to use a microphone
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
precious darling (often refers to one's child)/sweetheart
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
masquerade
the utmost care (idiom); to look after sb in every possible way
to forget previous differences/to bury the hatchet
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
lit. liver and guts cut to pieces (idiom)/fig. grief-stricken
quarrelsome but loving couple
lonely soul/solitary
snare of love
